KBRI Moskow Gelar Malam Gamelan di Museum of Oriental Rusia
05 Nov 2019, 03:12 by Faiq Hidayat
Moskow - KBRI Moskow mengadakan acara 'Malam Hari di Museum bersama Gamelan' di The State Museum of Oriental, Kota Moskow, Rusia. Acara pertunjukan gamelan ini bekerja sama dengan pihak The State Museum of Oriental.
Wakil Pertama Direktur Jenderal The State Museum of Oriental Art, Tatyana Metaksa, mengatakan pihak museum memiliki hubungan yang erat dengan KBRI Moskow dan sering menyelenggarakan berbagai kegiatan, seperti pameran foto Indonesia pada musim panas lalu, dan pertunjukan gamelan kali ini.
"Kita telah mendengarkan konser gamelan yang sangat menarik dan luar biasa. Terima kasih banyak kepada KBRI Moskow dan tim kesenian yang telah mempersembahkan seni budaya yang indah di museum ini," kata Tatyana Metaksa dalam keterangan tertulis KBRI Moskow, Selasa (5/11/2019).


Foto: Dok. KBRI Moskow

Pertunjukan gamelan dimainkan oleh Tim Kesenian Gamelan Dadali binaan KBRI Moskow. Sentuhan tangan-tangan lembut nan terampil para penabuh gamelan menghantarkan suatu alunan simfoni orkestra yang semakin menguatkan nuansa 'Night at the Museum' karena mampu menggetarkan perasaan dan dinikmati para pengunjung.
Semua penabuh gamelan, termasuk sinden, adalah warga Rusia yang sangat mencintai budaya Indonesia. Mereka adalah Anna Dyurina (saron), Anton Pinchuk (saron), Ekaterima Kamilova (bonang penerus), Ekaterina Mednikova (kenong), Elizaveta Moskvina (demung), Nikita Serdyuk (gong), Larisa Lazareva (peking), Yulia Ryzhaya (bonang barung), dan Ekaterina Makanina (bonang barung).

Indonesian Embassy in Moscow Holds Gamelan Night at the Museum of Oriental Russia
05 Nov 2019, 03:12 by Faiq Hidayat
Moscow - Indonesian Embassy in Moscow held a 'Night at a Museum with Gamelan' event at The State Museum of Oriental, Moscow City, Russia. This gamelan performance program in collaboration with The State Museum of Oriental.
First Deputy Director General of The State Museum of Oriental Art, Tatyana Metaksa, said that the museum has a close relationship with the Indonesian Embassy in Moscow and often organizes various activities, such as an Indonesian photo exhibition last summer, and gamelan performances this time.
"We have listened to a very interesting and extraordinary gamelan concert. Thank you very much to the Indonesian Embassy in Moscow and the art team who have presented beautiful cultural arts in this museum," Tatyana Metaksa said in a written statement from the Indonesian Embassy in Moscow, Tuesday (11/05/2019 ).


Photo: Doc. Indonesian Embassy in Moscow

Gamelan performance is played by the Dadali Gamelan Art Team guided by the Indonesian Embassy in Moscow. The gentle and skillful touches of the gamelan musicians delivered a symphonic orchestra that further strengthened the nuances of 'Night at the Museum' because it was able to thrill the feelings and be enjoyed by visitors.
All gamelan musicians, including Sinden, are Russian citizens who love Indonesian culture. They are Anna Dyurina (saron), Anton Pinchuk (saron), Ekaterima Kamilova (bonang successor), Ekaterina Mednikova (kenong), Elizaveta Moskvina (demung), Nikita Serdyuk (gong), Larisa Lazareva (peking), Yulia Ryzhaya (bonang barung) ), and Ekaterina Makanina (bonang barung).
